title: What is the most important technology used at IBM? - Quora

response.answer_text: Still the technology that everyone is striving to recreate artificially. The human assets that work with all of the other technologies. That isn't the answer you were looking for; but its true. After that then I’d see lots of cases for any number of technologies that could argue a strong case.

Personally for myself it was probably the Domino servers serving lotus notes. Supper resilient. Pity they didn't bother investing and just let a great software die slowly. Hardware wise clearly z series. They still have an impressive team working on powerpc architecture.
